deIdi2b2.TEXT:
Record date: 2098-03-20
Date 3/20/98 Time 6:30am Team B Admission Note
Patient: Keating, Frank Medical Record Number: 483 29 78 Room: T123 Date of Admission: 3/19/98 Attending Physician: Peter Floyd (Pullman rounder) Admitting Intern: Nathanael Guidry Code Status: full
Source: Patient, Medical Record
ID/CC: 76yoM h/o CAD, COPD, DM, paraplegia p/w fever, SOB.
History of Present Illness: Patient reports that over the past 3-4d, he has had the constellation of Fever (to 101F), chills/shivers/myalgias/arthralgias/anorexia. He has had a cough productive of white sputum. He has also had nausea/dry heaves, unclear if there have been aspiration events.
In the ED, VS: T98.5 BP80/40 150/106. The patient was initially hypotensive, initially responded to IVF, but BPs dipped back to SBP<100. WBC 14.0; he was Flu A +. CXR showed a possible R mid-lung opacity. He was given 4L IVF, ceftriaxone, azithromycin,
Review of Systems: Admits to SSCP-radiating to L side and back, nonpleuritc, nonpositional, similar to anginal equivalent; multiple episodes beginning at rest, lasting minutes. Chronic palpitations, LH dness, +/- nausea. + PND, LE edema stable. Chronic abdominal pain associated with colostomy. Patient denies the following symptoms. CONSTIUTIONAL: f/c/r/sweats, anorexia/weight-loss HEENT: h/a/ear pain/sore throat/rhinorrhea PULM:cough/SOB/DOE CV:LOC ABD: constipation/diarrhea/melena/BPR/ bloating GU: dysuria/frequency/urgency SKIN: rash NEURO: unilateral weakness/paresthesia/dysphasia/dysphagia/visual change.
Past Medical/Surgical History: Paraplegia 2066 Thrown from amusement park ride partial T4 paraplegia (confined to wheelchair, able to stand/xfer) ruptured bladder, S/p ileal loop conduit (2066) recurrent pyelonephritis, candidal infections Complete laminectomy c3-c7, C5-6, c6-7 R foraminotomy in 2081 Laminectomy L4-5, L5-s2 in 2081 11/2095 paraplegia at T8 after spinal cord infarction from cholesterol emboli after cardiac cath
CAD 2087 CABG x3 2095: Cath stent in L Cx artery 1/96 NSTEMI PVD S/p bilateral iliofemoral and renal artery stent 11/95 H/o TIA Bilateral CEA in 2081 CRI 2/2 DM, bilateral RAS Hypercholesterolemia DM2 PUD 12/95 EGD w/ nonbleeding gastric ulcers COPD Depression Sacral decubitus ulcer 2095 eroding into rectum 2096 c/b osteomyelitis requiring diverting colostomy Chronic RTA H/o significant epistaxis Hearing loss Insomnia
Received flu shot 11/97
H/o VRE, MRSA
S/p rod repair of tibial fx in 092
Allergies: Amitryptiline Benzocaine
Medications: Percocet 1tab
Social History: Lives with wife who is his primary care-taker. Requires help w/ almost all ADLs, including transfers. TOB: remote 2ppdx60y ETOH: remote, social ILLICITS: none Denies sick contacts, no travel.
Family History: NC
Physical Examination: GEN: appropriate, WA, NAD VS: T 96 P 50 BP 90/40 RR 14 O2SAT 97%2L
HEENT: MMM, JVP 8cm. PULM: no focal dullness/consolidation. Wheezes w/ moderate air movement. BACK: stage 3 decub over sacrum, did NOT probe to bone. Granulation tissue, no infection/drainage. CV: brady, reg, S1 and S2 normal, no murmurs ABD: soft, NT/ND/NM/NHSM. BS active. Colostomy/ileostomy bags in place. EXT: 1+ edema NEURO: MS A&Ox3 SENS up to T4 level. SKIN: no rash, good skin turgor
Data: NA 133(L) 134(L) 135 K 4.1 4.1 4.8(T) CL 107 111(H) 112(H) CO2 17.7(L) 15.6(L) 14.8(L) BUN 62(H) 69(H) 71(H) CRE 2.3(H) 2.2(H) 2.2(H) GLU 85 137(H) 106
CA 8.5 PHOS 4.3 MG 1.8 1.9 TBILI 0.4 DBILI 0.0 TP 7.9 ALB 4.0 GLOB 3.9 AMY 43 LIPS 2.6
ALT/SGPT 19 AST/SGOT 55(H) ALKP 142(H) TBILI 0.4 DBILI 0.0
CK 711(H) CK-MB 11.8(H) Negative Negative CKMBRI 1.7 TROP-I Negative Negative TROP-T 0.41(H)
WBC 6.2 14.0(H) RBC 3.20(L) 3.31(L) HGB 9.9(L) 10.2(L) HCT 30.7(L) 31.6(L) MCV 96 95 MCH 30.9 30.9 MCHC 32.2 32.4 PLT 275 313 RDW 14.8(H) 14.7(H) DIFFR Received METHOD Auto %NEUT 87(H) %LYMPH 10(L) %MONO 3(L) %EOS 0 %BASO 0 ANEUT 12.30(H) ALYMP 1.34 AMONS 0.37 AEOSN 0.01(L) ABASOP 0.02 ANISO None HYPO 1+(H) MACRO None MICRO None
PT 14.7(H) PT-INR 1.4
UA-GLUC Negative UA-KET Negative UA-SPGR 1.015 UA-BLD 2+ UA-PH 6.5 UA-PROT 3+ UA-NIT Negative UA-WBC 2+ MIC-SED Completed HCAST None UAS-RBC 5-10 UAS-WBC 50-100 UAS-BACT Many UAS-SQHI Few
EKG Sinus brady, TWI aVL. No change from previous. CXR patchy opacity in the R mid-lung.
Impression/Plan: 76yoM h/o paraplegia, p/w fever, cough. Likely flu, +/- PNA (CXR not that impressive). COPD flare on top of flu. Will cover with antibiotics, treat for COPD flare. Patient has been complaining of recent C/P, similar to anginal equivalent. Small troponin leak, likely in setting of hypovolemic hypotension.
HoTN: c/w aggressive fluid resuscitation. Patient clinically appears well. -IVF for now. -hold norvasc, imdur. Low dose lopressor for now. -if persistent hypotension, cort stim, consider more aggressive intervention. COUGH: flu + COPD +/- PNA. 5d into flu symptoms, will not treat w/ anti-viral medication. Will treat for COPD flare, as well as CAP coverage. -ceftriaxone/azithromycin x 7 days -prednisone taper 40mg 0mg over 12 days. Standing nebs. CHEST PAIN: small troponin leak, likely demand in setting of hypovolemic hypotension. -keep O2 sats 100%, HCT>30 (T&S to be sent) -ASA, lopressor, statin, plavix ARF: baseline Cr 1.5, now >2. suspect some amount of ATN. -did not correct after volume resuscitation -urine lytes, spin urine. NON-AG ACIDOSIS: related to ileostomy? -correcting w/ IVF. -if not back to baseline after resuscitation, initate work-up. PAIN: -home percocet, neurontin. DECUBITIS ULCER: stage 3 -CNS for appropriate therapeutic surface. FEN: low fat/cholesterol, no added salt, potassium 2g. PROPHY: nexium, heparin sc. CODE: FULL DISPO: to home when ready.
Nathanael Guidry, MD Pager: #32564
